==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|mittewoche}}, from {{inh|de|goh|mittawehha|lit=middle of the week}}, calqued on {{der|de|EL.|media hebdomas}} (compare {{cog|dlm|misedma}}, {{cog|roa-oit|mezzedima}}), which presumably replaced an earlier {{m|goh|*wuotanestag||[[w:Odin|Wuotan]]’s day}}. Compare {{cog|nds|Middeweek}}, {{cog|en|midweek}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|de|De-Mittwoch.oga|Mittwoch}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈmɪtvɔχ/|[ˈmɪtʰvɔχ]}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Mittwochs|gen2=Mittwoches|Mittwoche}} # [[Wednesday]] ====Usage notes==== * The genitive {{m|de|Mittwoches}} is rare. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|(e)s|e}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|Mittwoche|g=f}} * {{l|de|Wodenstag}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|mittwochs}} * {{l|de|Mittwochabend}} * {{l|de|mittwochabends}} * {{l|de|Mittwochmittag}} * {{l|de|mittwochmittags}} * {{l|de|Mittwochmorgen}} * {{l|de|mittwochmorgens}} * {{l|de|Mittwochnachmittag}} * {{l|de|mittwochnachmittags}} * {{l|de|mittwochnachts}} * {{l|de|Mittwochsausgabe}} * {{l|de|Mittwochvormittag}} * {{l|de|mittwochvormittags}} ===See also=== * {{l|de|[[Wochentag]]e}} * {{list:days of the week/de}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Days of the week]] ---- ==Pennsylvania German== {{wikipedia|lang=pdc}} ===Noun=== {{head|pdc|noun|g=m|plural|Mittwoche}} # [[Wednesday]] ===References=== * Earl C. Haag, ''Pennsylvania German Reader and Grammar'' (2010, {{ISBN|0271038098}} [[Category:pdc:Days of the week]]
